datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to cutting-edge inventions, future gadgets, and sci-fi concepts.

columns.name: households_with_internet_percent
columns.description: Percentage of households in the area that have internet access.

columns.name: digital_infrastructure_index
columns.description: An index from 0 to 10 measuring the quality and accessibility of digital infrastructure such as internet speed, public Wi-Fi access points, and digital education tools.

columns.name: public_interest_in_tech
columns.description: Binary indicator of public interest in technology, where 1 represents high interest and 0 represents low interest, based on surveys and media analysis.

columns.name: government_investment
columns.description: Amount of funds invested by the government in futuristic technology per year in millions.

columns.name: urban_area
columns.description: Whether the household is in an urban area

columns.name: household_income
columns.description: Categorical income levels of the household

columns.name: stem_graduate_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of the total population that graduates each year with a degree in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics.

columns.name: regulatory_change_rate
columns.description: The count of significant technology-related regulatory updates made per year.

columns.name: smart_home_ownership
columns.description: Indicates if the household has smart home systems installed

columns.name: VR_training_facility_present
columns.description: Indicates whether the household has a virtual reality setup for technical training

columns.name: tech_patent_applications_per_1000
columns.description: Number of technological patent applications filed per 1000 residents in the area annually.

columns.name: public_interest
columns.description: A rating from 0 to 100 reflecting public interest in adopting futuristic technologies in the area

columns.name: tech_workshops_frequency
columns.description: Number of technology-based workshops conducted in the region per year.

columns.name: decision_making_robots
columns.description: Whether robots used can perform tasks requiring human decision-making

columns.name: investment_in_tech_sector_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of the family's total investments that are allocated to technology sectors

columns.name: number_of_robots
columns.description: Number of robot assistants used in the household

columns.name: annual_tech_expos
columns.description: Counts the number of technology exhibitions held annually in the area

columns.name: flagship_tech_company_presence
columns.description: Indicates if there is at least one flagship technology company (e.g., major corporations in innovation) in the area

columns.name: tech_openness_score
columns.description: Score rating the household's openness to technology on a scale from 1 to 10

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the level of public interest in technology and the count of significant technology-related regulatory updates made per year?
queries.true_hypothesis: The count of significant technology-related regulatory updates made per year can be predicted by a combination of the percentage of the total population that graduates each year with a degree in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics, the level of public interest in technology indicated by surveys and media analysis, and the quality and accessibility of digital infrastructure measured by an index. A higher percentage of STEM graduates, increased public interest, and better digital infrastructure are associated with a higher count of annual regulatory changes related to technology.
